videos.overview: Several teams come together and target one set of Racers at the double U-Turn in Italy.

videos.title: Have Fun and Get It Done
videos.overview: Teams race through Venice, Italy where one team reaches a breaking point in a frantic search for a water taxi.

videos.title: Good Job, Donkey
videos.overview: While driving to the Detour, one team ends up going the wrong way, and a surprising U-turn causes friction between racers.

videos.title: I Thought We Were Playing It Nice
videos.overview: Teams battle the scorching heat while transporting shrimp baskets for one mile to a local fisherman, and one Racer approaches their breaking point during the exhausting Roadblock.

videos.title: Riding a Bike is Like Riding a Bike
videos.overview: Teams battle the scorching heat while transporting shrimp baskets for one mile to a local fisherman, and one Racer approaches their breaking point during the exhausting Roadblock.

videos.title: As Easy as Stacking Cups
videos.overview: - The final four teams race through Seoul, South Korea to clinch a spot in the finale and a chance to race for the one million dollar prize.

videos.title: We're Going to Victory Lane
videos.overview: The final three teams race to Chicago where they must complete their last challenges within the city's most iconic landmarks, including Wrigley Field, the home of the World Series champion Chicago Cubs, before they dash to the finish line.

videos.title: You're a Champion, Prove It
videos.overview: Teams begin their adventure in Washington Square Park in New York City and immediately travel to their first destination, Iceland, where they must traverse a massive canyon high above the Geitargljufur River.

videos.title: You're the Best French Fry Ever
videos.overview: For the first time ever, teams square off head-to-head in a competition to earn their place on the mat and avoid elimination.

videos.title: It's Gonna Be a Fragrant Day
videos.overview: Things get slimy at a fishy challenge, and Racers scale buildings and run through the narrow streets of Tangiers, Morocco.

videos.title: Gotta Put Your Sole Into It, Part 1
videos.overview: One team tries to stay on track after failing to read their clue, and teams face off against one another in the second head-to-head competition of the season.

videos.title: Gotta Put Your Sole Into It, Part 2
videos.overview: The race continues in Provence, France.

videos.title: The Claws Are Out
videos.overview: The stakes are high when teams face the dreaded double U-turn and racers struggle to navigate the streets of Prague while delivering kegs to a local party.

videos.title: All's Fair in Love and War, Part 1
videos.overview: For the first time, Racers swap teammates for an entire leg. Also, the game becomes ruthless with another double U-turn.

videos.title: All's Fair in Love and War, Part 2
videos.overview: The race continues in Harare, Zimbabwe.

videos.title: The First Rule of Amazing Race Club, Part 1
videos.overview: For the first time, the Race travels to Bahrain, where one team's game is on the line when one of them misplaces their passport.

videos.title: The First Rule of Amazing Race Club, Part 2
videos.overview: The race continues in Chiang Mai, Thailand, where scorpions are on the menu

videos.title: It's Just a Million Dollars, No Pressure, Part 1
videos.overview: The race continues in Hong Kong.

videos.title: It's Just a Million Dollars, No Pressure, Part 2
videos.overview: The race concludes in San Francisco.

videos.title: You're in Our Race Now
videos.overview: The Emmy Award-winning The Amazing Race returns with the first reality showdown among some of the most memorable and competitive players from The Amazing Race, Survivor and Big Brother.

videos.title: Knock the Newbie Out of Us
videos.overview: Racers have a big decision to make when they face a surprise double U-turn in Laos.

videos.title: Here Fishy, Fishy, Fishy
videos.overview: Teams travel to Vietnam where they must master synchronized dancing, karaoke singing and fishing for prawns.

videos.title: I Took Out a Polar Bear
videos.overview: Enemies are made when one team steals another team's taxi in Ho Chi Minh, Vietnam.

videos.title: I'm a Bird, I'm a Plane, I'm on The Amazing Race!
videos.overview: Teams take a leap of faith when choosing which detour challenge to take on, and a split-second decision may make or break one team's life in the race.

videos.title: Who Wants a Rolex?
videos.overview: Teams must drum up enough strength for an intense head-to-head battle before checking into the mat.

videos.title: Living Fearlessly
videos.overview: Teams travel to Switzerland where they free-fall over 400 feet into the Gletscherschlucht Glacier Gorge.

videos.title: You're the Apple in My Eye
videos.overview: While in Switzerland, teams are surprised with the first ever public U-turn vote, where racers have to vote in front of each other.

videos.title: Let's Split!
videos.overview: Teams take a bumpy ride in Split, Croatia and try not to get tongue-twisted reciting poetry while in motion.

videos.title: Chugga Chugga Choo Choo!
videos.overview: The final five teams try not to crack while transporting eggs across town by bicycle in the Netherlands.

videos.title: This One is For One Million Dollars
videos.overview: With the $1 million on the line, the final four teams Race through London, where they take a helicopter ride to Dover Castle, and through Detroit, where they rappel nearly 500 feet down the Guardian Building. The team to cross the finish line first will be crowned the winners of THE AMAZING RACE.

videos.title: One Million Miles
videos.overview: The globe-trotting teams begin their adventure, which filmed prior to the global outbreak of the coronavirus, from the iconic Hollywood Bowl in Los Angeles, and travel to their first destination, Trinidad and Tobago. Along the route, teams will travel to France, Germany, Kazakhstan, Brazil and more. The team that crosses the finish line first will be crowned the winners of THE AMAZING RACE and the $1 million prize.

videos.title: Red Lipstick Is Not My Color
videos.overview: Teams race through Bogot, Colombia where they encounter the "Yield," which gives them the power to stop another team's race for a designated amount of time.

videos.title: We're Makin' Big Moves
videos.overview: Teams are in Manaus, Brazil where they have big decisions to make when they encounter the first U-turn of the Race.

videos.title: Ol, Ol!
videos.overview: Teams race through Asuncin, Paraguay when they compete in a series of switchback Detours from season 20, where they must either stack a pyramid of watermelons or perform a traditional Paraguayan bottle dance.

videos.title: You Don't Strike Me as a Renaissance Man
videos.overview: Teams are in Paris, France where they must whip up some tasty treats and make enough Crme Chantilly for four pies, as well as compete in a series of carnival games.

videos.title: I'm Not Even Walking, I'm Falling
videos.overview: Teams reach new heights in Berlin, Germany as they walk face-first down the exterior of a building for nearly 200 feet.

videos.title: Give Me a Beard Bump
videos.overview: Teams travel to Almaty, Kazakhstan where they brave the cold weather while perfecting a choreographed fight scene and decorating a yurt.

videos.title: Are You a Rickshaw?
videos.overview: In the first ever "Mega Leg" in the show's history, teams race through Hyderabad, India where they must complete double the detours and double the road blocks and travel double the distance.

videos.title: This is Not Payback, This is Karma
videos.overview: The first ever "Mega Leg" in RACE history continues through Hyderabad, India where teams compete in double the detours and double the road blocks and travel double the distance.

videos.title: Getting Down to the Nitty Gritty
videos.overview: The final five teams race through Siem Reap, Cambodia where they face the second and final double U-turn.

videos.title: Run on Your Tippy Toes
videos.overview: In the first-ever city sprint, the final four teams will have no road blocks, no detours and complete every challenge as a team as fast as they can when they race through Manila, the capital of the Philippines, on the penultimate leg of THE AMAZING RACE.

videos.title: Now It's About Winning
videos.overview: With the $1 million prize on the line, the final three teams travel to New Orleans where, after visiting 11 countries, 17 cities and travelling more than 33,000 miles, one team will be crowned the winners of THE AMAZING RACE.

videos.title: We're Back!
videos.overview: THE AMAZING RACE begins its historic 33rd trip around the world when 11 new teams take off from their homes and travel to their first destination, London, England.

videos.title: It Can't Be That Easy
videos.overview: The 10 remaining teams race around London, England.

videos.title: Who Has This One in the Bag?
videos.overview: While racing through Scotland in February 2020, teams receive shocking and unprecedented news  for the first time in the show's history, THE AMAZING RACE suspends production due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

videos.title: Ready To Restart The Race
videos.overview: Host Phil Keoghan gathers the teams in Switzerland to restart the Race nearly 20 months after production was suspended for the pandemic, and the longest pit stop in the show's history.

videos.title: Stairway to Hell
videos.overview: Teams race through Switzerland, where Racers bungee jump over 700 feet off the Verzasca Dam.

videos.title: Say Cheese
videos.overview: Racers travel by private jet to Corsica, France, where they go canyoneering through the beautiful landscape of natural rockslides, waterfalls, and rivers.

videos.title: Gently Down the Stream
videos.overview: Teams continue racing through Corsica, France, where each team member must try a piece of casu martzu, also known as maggot cheese.

videos.title: Souvlaki
videos.overview: Teams travel to Halkidiki, Greece, where they are tested on their spelling and memory skills.

videos.title: Rock Bottom
videos.overview: Racers leave no stone unturned while looking for a clue in Thessaloniki, Greece.

videos.title: No Room for Error
videos.overview: The final four teams race through Setubal, Portugal and Los Angeles to claim the grand prize.

videos.title: In the Hands of the Amazing Race Gods
videos.overview: After traveling to seven countries, 17 cities and enduring the longest Pit Stop ever due to the COVID-19 pandemic, one team will be crowned the winners of THE AMAZING RACE and win the $1 million prize.

videos.title: Many Firsts But Don't Be Last
videos.overview: Twelve new teams start their journey on The Amazing Race outside the U.S., in Munich, Germany, and in this season's shocking new twist, one team will be eliminated at the end of every leg.

videos.title: Patience, Is the New Me
videos.overview: Teams explore the beauty of Austria and must learn a traditional wedding dance, yodel and a song performed on alpine bells.

videos.title: It's All In the Details
videos.overview: Teams start a Megaleg in Bologna, Italy, where they must cart an 88-pound wheel of parmigiano cheese and build a Ducati Panigale V4 motorcycle.

videos.title: Everyone's an Artist
videos.overview: Teams continue the megaleg and make their way to Florence, where they chisel out a sculpture from a large block of plaster and crash a fashion photo shoot.

videos.title: The Amazing Race of Arabia
videos.overview: For the first time in AMAZING RACE history, teams travel to the Kingdom of Jordan. They will ride a train and experience a scene reminiscent of the 1963 Oscar-winning film "Lawrence of Arabia," search the Wadi Rum desert and visit the ancient city of Petra.

videos.title: Step By Step
videos.overview: A shocking elimination takes place while teams continue their Jordanian journey in the "white city." Teams take part in a traditional folk dance and learn the Arabic alphabet.

videos.title: It's Simply Medieval
videos.overview: Teams drive to Dordogne, France, the city of 1,001 castles, where they will extract walnut oil, play three medieval games and flex their memory muscles while rappelling down the side of a castle.

videos.title: La Ville Rose
videos.overview: Teams drive to Toulouse, France, known as the "Pink City," where they must run, tackle and kick their way through a roadblock while training with a champion pro rugby team.

videos.title: Vamos a la Playa
videos.overview: Teams embark on a megaleg in Malaga, Spain, where racers become grill masters and brave rough waters.

videos.title: Don't Look Down
videos.overview: Teams continue the megaleg in Ronda, Spain, where they must choose to build an arch brick by brick or dress for success.

videos.title: How Am I Going to Survive This?
videos.overview: The final four teams race through Iceland to clinch a spot in the finale and a chance to win the $1 million prize.

videos.title: The Only Leg That Matters
videos.overview: The final three teams travel 3,000 miles to race through Nashville for the final showdown, where they must deliver guitars and play a giant floor piano to win the $1 million prize.

videos.title: The Amazing Race Is Back!
videos.overview: This Emmy Award-winning and recently nominated THE AMAZING RACE begins its milestone 35th season at the iconic Hollywood Sign, celebrating the famous landmark's 100th anniversary, before heading to their first location: Thailand.

videos.title: You Don't See That at Home
videos.overview: Teams dive deeper into the countryside of Thailand for the second leg of the race, encountering catfish-infested waters and pomelo-filled rivers.

videos.title: No Sleep and a Million Dollar Dream
videos.overview: The teams feel the strain of commercial travel and float their way through the Mekong Delta as they are challenged between making rice paper or customizing a scooter by wrapping it in vinyl in Vietnam.

videos.title: The Day Keeps Rockin' Here In Vietnam
videos.overview: Teams continue racing in Vietnam and face the hustle and bustle of a congested Vietnamese market, where they must properly set up a fish stand and deliver mattresses to a local hotel.

videos.title: Yessir, the Pink City
videos.overview: Teams travel more than 2,000 miles from Vietnam to India where they must balance traditional pots on their heads while performing a folk dance and assemble a life-size, three-dimensional mural.

videos.title: Driving Head On Into Scooters
videos.overview: For the first time in THE AMAZING RACE history, the votes for the mandatory U-turn are in and one team must complete both detours in India, bundling up flowers and transporting building materials on rickshaws in the bustling streets of Jaipur.

videos.title: Like Two Cats Fighting in a Car
videos.overview: Having experienced the U-turn in India, relationships are tested as teams take on their first self-drive leg in Germany. Also, teams rappel down a castle wall and use their taste buds to identify different mustards.

videos.title: A Planes, Trains and Automobiles Day
videos.overview: For the first time in THE AMAZING RACE history, teams visit the country of Slovenia. Racers will soar to new heights in glider planes, experience roadblock surprises and battle to remain in the race.

videos.title: In the Belly of the Earth
videos.overview: Teams continue racing in Slovenia, carefully traveling on foot carrying wooden pieces on their back, descending deep into a cave and assembling a giant dragon and scraping off mussels and barnacles in the waters.

videos.title: Everyone Loves a Comeback Story
videos.overview: Teams travel 1,000 miles from Slovenia to Sweden, where they must face their fears and skydive from 10,000 feet over the Baltic Sea, recreate a midsummer tradition and sort through recyclable items.

videos.title: We're Finding Our Pot of Gold
videos.overview: Teams travel to Dublin, Ireland, where they must complete four challenges in the penultimate leg including swimming in the Irish Sea, dancing with the legendary Riverdance troupe, scoring a point with the hurling team and reciting quotes from a famed Irish novelist.

videos.title: A Sunset, Seattle Scramble
videos.overview: The final three teams travel to Seattle, where they must complete three challenges in a scramble leg, a first in AMAZING RACE history. The challenges are inspired by Seattle's art scene and include swinging from a high trapeze, glassblowing and being a roadie for a grunge band. The team that successfully completes these challenges and arrives first will win the $1 million prize.

videos.title: You Can't Drive While You're Crying
videos.overview: Thirteen new teams embark on the journey of a lifetime when host Phil Keoghan kicks off the 36th season of the CBS Original series THE AMAZING RACE. Teams begin in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico where they participate in a traditional Mexican rodeo and try to lasso their way to the finish line without coming in last.

videos.title: Trust But Verify
videos.overview: Teams continue the megaleg in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, where they must choose between detours that get them ready for a fiesta.

videos.title: It's Not Over Til Phil Sings
videos.overview: Teams climb the stairs to the top of El Peon de Guatap in Colombia to find their clue and begin the third leg of the race.

videos.title: Those Who Wander Are Not Lost
videos.overview: Teams paraglide their way to the start of this leg in Medelln, Colombia where they must choose between detours getting in sync' or decoding a rebus puzzle.'

videos.title: Save The Stress For Later
videos.overview: To begin this leg of the Race in Santiago, Chile, teams self-drive in search of Marilyn Monroe's iconic Thunderbird car to receive their next clue.

videos.title: Our Alliance Strikes Again
videos.overview: Teams compete in double the roadblocks and double the detours on a megaleg in Argentina.

videos.title: Walk And Chew Gum Baby
videos.overview: Teams must put on their best performance in Montevideo, Uruguay, when they choose between banging out a drum routine with street performers or singing a Spanish tune with professional troubadours at the detour.

videos.title: That's What Being Strong Will Do
videos.overview: For the first time in THE AMAZING RACE history, teams travel to Barbados where they visit the childhood home of superstar Rihanna.

videos.title: My Precious Cacao
videos.overview: For the first time, the Race travels to the Dominican Republic, where the final five teams must complete two road blocks.

videos.title: The Longest Minute of Your Life
videos.overview: In the penultimate leg, the final four teams compete for the chance to make the final three and one racer receives the surprise of a lifetime after their elimination. Then, in the final leg, the remaining three teams get schooled in American history, and after eight countries, 14 cities and 11,711 miles, one team will be crowned the winners of THE AMAZING RACE and win the $1 million prize.

videos.title: Double the Stakes, Double the Eliminations
videos.overview: Host Phil Keoghan sends 14 teams, the largest cast ever, on the journey of a lifetime. At the first destination, Hong Kong, teams encounter their first surprise twist of the season when they confront the inaugural Fork in the Road, forcing them to choose which direction and route they want to take to the Pit Stop, creating two parallel races where two teams will be eliminated.

videos.title: Very Strong Warrior Energy
videos.overview: Teams depart for Osaka, Japan, where they encounter an Intersection at the Roadblock, forcing one partner to team up with a member of another team and complete a challenge performing the taiko drums

videos.title: Chaotic, Crazy, That's What We're Used To
videos.overview: The stakes are high at the Roadblock! Racers must play the ancient Japanese game of kemari and the first team with both members to successfully complete the game will win the express pass.

videos.title: There's No Addresses in the Jungle
videos.overview: Racers travel to Bali, Indonesia, where the first team to arrive must make a difficult decision.

videos.title: It's Not Personal, It's Business
videos.overview: Host Phil Keoghan shocks the teams when he announces a surprise where teams must cast their vote live, and the two teams with the most votes are required to complete both detours.

videos.title: It Smells Like the Desert
videos.overview: Racers skydive over the city of Dubai, and one team will win the classic game piece the Fast Forward, allowing them to skip all remaining tasks and head straight to the Pit Stop

videos.title: Be One With the Hay
videos.overview: For the first time ever, teams travel to Bulgaria where they face a surprise double U-Turn.

videos.title: We're Letting Race Brain Win
videos.overview: Teams continue traveling through Bulgaria where the Express Pass is up for grabs, and one team makes a critical mistake that could jeopardize their race.

videos.title: The Pizza de Rsistance
videos.overview: Teams travel to Naples, Italy, where they must perfect their pizza-making skills.

videos.title: Up the River Without a Joust
videos.overview: Racers travel to Strasbourg, France, where they go head-to-head in a water jousting match.

videos.title: My Knight in Shining Armor
videos.overview: In the penultimate leg of the Race, the remaining four teams travel through Portugal, where they look to earn their place in the final.

videos.title: We're in Miami Baby!
videos.overview: Teams race to Miami where, after nine countries, 18 cities and more than 29,000 miles, one team will be crowned the winners of THE AMAZING RACE and receive the $1 million prize.

videos.title: Two Worlds Colliding
videos.overview: The racers kick off the season in Amsterdam, where they face classic game pieces and unexpected twists right off the bat.

videos.title: Mom's Gonna Have the Willies
videos.overview: Teams depart for Prague, Czech Republic, where they must walk across a narrow plank hundreds of feet above the Zizkov Television Tower to retrieve their next clue.

videos.title: Cry and Rally
videos.overview: Racers travel to Kutn Hora, Czech Republic, where a new alliance takes control.

videos.title: What Would Houdini Do?
videos.overview: Racers travel to illusionist Harry Houdini's birthplace, Budapest, Hungary, where a puzzling Fast Forward puts one team to the test; a horse drawn carriage has teams racing against the clock.

videos.title: I Wanna Be a Little Angry Right Now
videos.overview: Teams travel to Croatia; a frustrating roadblock brings some teams to tears.

videos.title: The System Hacked Me
videos.overview: The race intensifies in Croatia where one team reconsiders their alliance and another team's Roadblock strategy falls apart.

videos.title: It Feels Like Falling the Whole Time
videos.overview: Teams skydive through the clouds of Romania and one team must catch up after struggling during a sheep herding challenge.

videos.title: Oh Egg, Where Art Thou
videos.overview: In Bucharest, two teams strategically use their Express Pass, eager to gain an advantage; navigational frustration reaches a boiling point for another team.

videos.title: I'm Not a Big Fan of Olives
videos.overview: Phil sends the teams off to race through Athens, Greece.

videos.title: It's Hard Not to Feel Hopeless
videos.overview: Racers visit Milan, Italy, where one team faces a major setback when they're forced to travel an hour behind the pack; heat exhaustion threatens to end the race for another team.

videos.title: The Can't Can't
videos.overview: The final four teams race through Moulin Rouge, the Eiffel Tower and other iconic Paris locations.

videos.title: One Million Cookies
videos.overview: The final three teams race through New York City where they rappel down the Empire State Building and host Phil Keoghan crowns one team the winner.
